intro: Spathipappus griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan spathipappus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white to pale yellow petals, often surrounded by a series of small, bract-like structures. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, adapted to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. Spathipappus griffithii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
